text: Does anyone know if it's possible to add some sort of data to a form submit? I have built a "perfect match"-questionnaire where we use the same form for both final answers. Is there any way of adding a positive/negative tag that will let my client see what the questionnaire results were to the result? Or do I have to use separate forms?
Do `current_page_num` `last_page_num` in a blog listing represent the index values, or the numerical page values?

We have an example of blog pagination in our theme boilerplate that might help:
<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/tree/main/src/modules/blog-pagination.module>

Other question: working within a preview mode, getting -1 for the `last_page_num` index. I presume because its in preview, but is there any way to accurately replicate blog pagination and listing behavior without publishing first?
Trying to avoid working within a production environment, even though I can password protect (I believe). Want to get as close to production-ready as I can.
I can easily mock the values, which I will do as I proceed.

I would do it in a sandbox account. Then the blog isnt live with the changes. Until youre ready. And pushing the change live is as easy as just uploading your updated template to the production account when ready
Hey everyone! I need to add extra field for blog post picture. How do I add it? Im working with the cli tool.
